subject: p15378103
History: Worsening respiratory failure. Patient with question TRALI.
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study,. Diffuse lung opacities, larger on the left side, have worsened on the right. This could be due to TRALI or ARDS. Cardiomediastinal contours are unchanged with mild cardiomegaly and widened mediastinum. Lines and tubes are in unchanged standard position. Small bilateral pleural effusions are unchanged. Patient has known fibrosis in the right lower lobe. Sternal wires are aligned.
